alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, southwestern Greene and northern Daviess Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Washington, or 13 miles northeast of Vincennes, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Knox, southwestern Greene and northern Daviess Counties, including the following locations... Newberry, Lyons, Odon, Edwardsport, Elnora, Bicknell, Freelandville, Wheatland, Plainville and Sandborn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Indiana.
